metadata.title: CVE-2020-29599 on Ubuntu 21.04 (hirsute) - negligible.
metadata.description: ImageMagick before 6.9.11-40 and 7.x before 7.0.10-40 mishandles the -authenticate option, which allows setting a password for password-protected PDF files. The user-controlled password was not properly escaped/sanitized and it was therefore possible to inject additional shell commands via coders/pdf.c.

notes.note: mdeslaur> ghostscript formats are disabled in Ubuntu packaging, we are not vulnerable to this issue

criterions.comment: imagemagick package in hirsute, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8:6.9.11.60+dfsg-1ubuntu1').
